abstract: A new report by the International Data Corporation that details a steep drop in global PC sales in the first quarter this year appears to bolster Dell’s argument for going private.
snippet: A new report by the International Data Corporation that details a steep drop in global PC sales in the first quarter this year appears to bolster Dell’s argument for going private.
lead_paragraph: It is becoming harder to believe that a turnaround of Dell  will be anything but messy – and shareholders may not want to stick around for that part.

headline.main: PC Sales Data May Bolster Case for Taking Dell Private

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
